classes

Class Shoe

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.Shoe

  • public class Shoe
extends java.lang.Object
    The shoe class is where the cards to be played with are stored. Only the dealer has access to the shoe. The shoe represents a real shoe in a blackjack game. It is associated to a dealer and can be generated by the number of decks in interactive and simulation modes or can be read from a file in debug mode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shoe

        public Shoe(int nrDecks,
            java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardsinit,
            java.lang.String mode,
            int shuffles)
        Constructor for class Shoe. Receives the number of total decks, an array of cards (for debug mode, read from the input file), the game mode and the percentage of the shoe to be used before a shuffle is performed. Initializes the local variables and, depending on the game mode, initializes the shoe, if in debug mode, by the array of cards, otherwise by generating the number of cards according to the number of decks.
        Parameters:
        nrDecks - input parameter of the number of decks to be used 1 if in debug mode
        cardsinit - array of cards to be used in the debug mode
        mode - input parameter regarding the game mode
        shuffles - input parameter regarding the percentage of the shoe to be used before shuffling

    • Method Detail

      • getNrDecksLeft

        int getNrDecksLeft()
        Return the number of decks left, according to the number of cards taken from the shoe and the initial number of decks.
        Returns:
        number of decks left

      • getNrCardsTaken

        int getNrCardsTaken()
        Returns the number of cards taken from the shoe, until a shuffle is done. Then it is reset.
        Returns:
        number of cards taken

      • getNrCards

        int getNrCards()
        Returns the number of total cards in the shoe. The parameter is only modified in the constructor of the shoe.
        Returns:
        number cards in the shoe

      • getShufflesDone

        int getShufflesDone()
        Returns the number of shuffles performed since the beggining of the game. This variable is used in simulation mode.
        Returns:
        number of shuffles performed

      • getRunningCnt

        int getRunningCnt()
        Returns the value of the running count which is used in the high-low strategy.
        Returns:
        value of the running count

      • getAceFive

        int getAceFive()
        Returns the value of the ace-five variable, which is used in the ace-five strategy.
        Returns:
        value of ace-five

      • addCard

        void addCard(Card c)
        Adds a card to the shoe, it is used in the shoe constructor and when a card is taken from the shoe it is used to readd it. Receives the card to be added.
        Parameters:
        c - card to be added

      • Shuffle

        void Shuffle()
        Shuffles the shoe.

      • runningCntValue

        int runningCntValue(Card c)
        Receives a card as argument and based on the value of the received card returns the card's running count value, as specified in the project. This value is to be added to the runningCnt attribute.
        Parameters:
        c - card analysed
        Returns:
        the card's running count value

      • aceFiveValue

        int aceFiveValue(Card c)
        Receives a card as argument an returns the value of the ace-five value of the card. This value is to be added to the aceFive attribute.
        Parameters:
        c - card to be analysed
        Returns:
        card's ace-five value

      • getCard

        Card getCard()
        Gets a card from the shoe and returns it. This method is only used by the dealer as the player is not supposed to access the shoe. The number of decks left, number of cards taken, running count value, ace-five value and shuffles performed attributes are set and/or reset in this function. If the card taken is an ace, it's value is reset to 11 as it may be 1. If the conditions to shuffle are met the shuffling is called and the attributes are reset.
        Returns:
        card taken from the shoe
